title: Lux's Ult should be able to be interrupted.
body:
I used to believe that you could interrupt it with cc, but i have been proven wrong! 
i used to believe it was like any other channeled ability (fiddlesticks R, Karthus R, Katarina R etc.)
But its not true, even if you stun her or knock her up it still fires. Now i ask you where is the counterplay there?
mid teamfight she can just press R and hit everyone, she doesn't even need to get back out of the fighting to do it.
surely if you see her start her ult animation and you have a stun etc etc, you should be able to stop her.

imagine if you couldnt stop Karthus from ulting, if as soon as he pressed R no matter what, it would hit you, that would be utter bs. as it is, if you want to land your ult as karthus you need to either 

1. Move out of the battle (wayyy out) 

2. Die

Lux doesn't need to do either, she just presses R whenever the mood suits knowing that no matter what happens (unless 100% of her health disappears in under 0.5 seconds) she will fire her ult.

Now this situation really rustles my jimmies: She was in the cast animation for her ult (and the little red line had only just appeared) when our bard's ult hit her in an attempt to save a team mate, and not kidding (while all Zhonya's golden) her ult STILL fired.

if you are going to make her ult invulnerable, then do so to Karthus' and Kat's and Fiddle's and Xerath's etc. as well.
keep the rules the same for everyone.

give her some counterplay. seriously.

and lol you seriously think i would do that? xD don't think you're so important.

Why are you using Shen's Dash as the go to point for lux's ult?

But really it's mainly because she would have too much counterplay if it worked like that, Get snared, E'd Ult'd, oh no wait you used CC and interrupted her ult to live.

EDIT: As a note, if you want her ult to be interruptible, you have to live with her Q being a multi stun.

Because its the first ability that popped to my mind that isn't a channeled ability that can be interrupted.

she wouldnt have that much more counterplay, it just means she needs to leave a fight in order to ult, just like other mages like karthus and xerath, or champs like Jhin and the likes.
